intro: Leontice altaica var. odessana, commonly known as the Odessa leontice, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of southern Russia and parts of Eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, terminal clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a hairy surface and a slightly serrated edge. This species is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and along the edges of forests.
